content1.text: Poppy Playtime is a first-person horror-puzzle adventure game developed by MOB Games Studio, which consists of a small team directed by Isaac Christopherson.
Poppy Playtime divided into multiple chapters around the abandoned Playtime Co. factory

specializing in producing “the nation’s favorite toys.” As a former employee at the toy factory, in Poppy Playtime you uncover the mystery behind the disappearances of employees. You progress further into the mysterious
factory with your Grabpack while you sneak around the dangerous toys like Huggy Wuggy ahead.
Poppy Playtime is a horror adventure in which you find yourself trapped inside a strange toy factory. PlaytimeCo. was once a leader in the toy manufacturing sector.

content2.text: but according to the plot of the Poppy Playtime game one day all the employees of the factory suddenly disappeared. After that, the place remained abandoned for a long time. In Poppy Playtime you decide to investigate the seemingly
The Farmer and the Old Shovel

Speak with the man hoeing outside of grandpa’s house to obtain this quest. Next, travel southeast of him following the signs for Calo Cabbage Patch to find Zirra in her water fields. Look for the strip of tan along the bank to enter the water then speak with Zirra. She’ll need you to return to the farmer near grandpa’s house and ask him for the shovel. Do so and this will earn you The farmer and the old shovel trophy!

content3.text: In the game Poppy Playtime, you will use the GrabPack, one of the items used by the old Playtime Co. Employees. It is a backpack equipped with a pair of arms attached to steel cables that,

Afterwards, make your way back north and go through the gates. Head straight ahead and use the bridge to cross the river. Continue straight along the path to reach a map transition right after which you’ll meet Moiro and he’ll give you a side quest! Keep pressing forward to trigger a brief scene in which Luna says that we must find another way. She’ll run away and fall down a hole. Unfortunately, you cannot just drop down the hole after her so head back to the bridge leading to Rodia Town. Take a left in front of the bridge and follow the path left (south) along the river. Drop down the grassy cliffs to reach a dark brown area with archways. Follow the archways southwest then head across the stone bridge to find Junpei. Defeat the plant that lunges to save the boy who will then tell you about a secret passage into Rodia Town! When fighting this enemy, it’s extremely helpful to have a shield to block its lunging attacks. Once you deflect the attacks, hit it with your sword. After you hear about the well, continue forward through the bamboo and head along the river to find the well. Climb down it to reach The Underground! Click here for a guide on The Underground dungeon! Once you reach the town, you’ll receive the Rodia Town trophy!

content4.text:
You’ll receive this quest after reaching a certain point in The Underground. Click here for a guide on this! Topazzo will tell you that one lever is missing. You’ll need to find his sister Topa in Jacu Oasis. She’ll be dressed in red and her house is the tallest in Jacu Oasis with a big windmill on top. He suggests that the blacksmith might be able to help us turn the rod she’ll give us into a lever to replace the missing one. Furthermore, he’ll say that we need something to resist the incredible heat during the day but at night we should be prepared for the extreme cold. Since it’s still night in the game, you’ll need to prepare for the cold. As such a Kangmi Coat is in order. Click here for a guide on how to get one from the Kangmi Fur side quest! Once you’re prepared for the cold, travel to the Bobo Temple fast travel point then exit this area via the western map transition. Keep heading southeast, working your way through the map transitions, until you reach a place called Garduo Rocks. When you’re here, follow the path straight and cross the wooden bridge. Climb up to the tall rock immediately to the north of you to find a fast travel point. Make your way to the southeastern map transition. In the next area, you’ll again need to continue making your way to the southeastern map transition to trigger a cutscene for the Mauri Desert. Follow the dark path in the sand. You’ll pass a Minisio’s Map Shop along the way.

Be sure to stop in and grab the map for the desert! Eventually, you’ll reach Jacu Oasis! Speak with Topa, who is wearing all red to receive the ancient rod and complete the quest. Before this rod can be used as a lever, it’ll need to be fixed by the blacksmith in Rodia.

You’ll receive this quest after completing The Ancient Lever quest. In order to fix the ancient rod given to you by Topa in Jacu Oasis, you’ll need to head to the blacksmith in Rodia. He’ll fix it for you and the quest will complete.
Poppy Playtime, allow you to grab items from afar, lift heavy objects, and perform a series of actions that will allow you to solve complex puzzles as you explore the Poppy Playtime factory.
Poppy Playtime is a horror game where the main goal is to survive. Once a leader in toy production, Playtime is now an abandoned factory that has been keeping secrets for years

content6.text: Poppy Playtime you need to figure out where all the toys have gone, while staying alive. Huggy Wuggy in Poppy Playtime is one of the antagonists of the game, about whom useful information is gathered below.
It's worth noting right away that Huggy Wuggy is the company's most successful toy in Poppy Playtime, designed to hug children

The establishment even has a large statue of the children's favorite. The big blue guy doesn't seem to have any bones. He's huge and that doesn't stop him from going through the same holes in Poppy Playtime as you do with ease.
Poppy Playtime's antagonist is modeled after a doll, but there's no information on whether it's a toy that came to life or something else. Huggy Wuggy

content7.text: At first, the villain in Poppy Playtime is very slow and easy to get away from. After a conveyor belt battle, things change, the enemy maintains the same pace as you do
Huggy Wuggy appears to be a robot until you clearly see the villain's mouth. Another hint of Huggy Wuggy's awareness in Poppy Playtime.

You’ll receive this quest after completing Meet Luna in Rodia Town. To make progress on this quest, you’ll need to head to Bobo Temple / The Underground. For a guide on this area, click here! After you complete the quests for The Ancient Lever and The Mechanism, you’ll then be able to continue in The Underground. Click here for the next guide on The Underground, Maluna’s Second Castle Gardens and the Abandoned Royal Mansion! Once you obtain the Owl Bomb in the Abandoned Royal Mansion, the quest will complete.
As you flee from the monster through the vent, there are messages on the walls begging you to come back, mixed in with hilarious phrases. It is possible that Huggy Wuggy wrote them himself.
